fieldset.label: Registration settings
fieldset.description: Select global registration and free subscriptions settings:

param.name: registrationPlansEnabled
param.label: Show subscription plans at registration
param.description: Whether you want to display subscription plans at registration screen.

param.name: enableFreeRegisteredUser
param.label: Allow Free Registered Users (without subscriptions)
param.description: YES means users with no subscription records for plans will be allowed to login as Registered users. NO means that these (e.g. existing) users will be blocked from logging in and will be proposed with possible subscription upgrades. If YES, they will be allowed and receive normal CB confirmation emails.

param.name: createAlsoFreeSubscriptions
param.label: Create Subscriptions also for free lifetime plans
param.description: YES means that a subscription record will be created for all plan types, also for free lifetime plans (without different first validity). NO means that no subscription records will be created for simple free lifetime plans. In the NO case, they are automatically shown as belonging to first free lifetime plan with User-Group-level `Registered`. Setting this to NO and also NOT allowing free registered users doesn't make sense.

param.name: warning_free_incoherent
param.label: WARNING
param.default: WARNING: This setting does not make sense: free registered users without subscriptions not allowed, but subscriptions are not created for all plans, including free lifetime ones. In that mode that controls all site users through paid subscriptions, subscriptions are needed for all plans.

fieldset.description: Select global registration, upgrade, renewals, and free subscriptions settings:

param.description: Whether you want to display renew buttons with subscribed subscription plans.

param.name: upgradePlansEnabled

param.description: Whether you want to display subscription plan upgrade possibilities with the subscriptions.

fieldset.name: fieldset_invoices_numberings_help
fieldset.label: Substitutions in Invoice number format
fieldset.description: You can substitute text in Proforma Invoice number format and in Invoice number format using following strings:

param.label: [PREFIX_TEXT]
param.default: Letter depending on payment type: N for new subscriptions during registration, R for Renewing an existing subscription, U for Upgrade to a new subscription.

param.label: [NUMBER]
param.default: [NUMBER] for strictly incrementing unique numbers for the corresponding type of invoice number starting at 1 (or the number displayed above that can be reset to a given value).

param.label: [NUMBER:firstnumber]
param.default: This is same as [NUMBER], except that you can set the format [NUMBER:1] starting at 1 (where 1 can be replaced by the starting number of your choice, and a fixed number of filler 0s can be added in front: e.g. [NUMBER:000012] will display invoice 211 as 000211).

param.label: [NUMBER:firstnumber:RESTART:period]
param.default: Optionally a numbering restart time can be set with :RESART:period (no spaces), e.g. [NUMBER:1:RESTART:YEARLY], where instead of YEARLY, MONTHLY and DAILY are also supported.

param.label: [YEAR], [YEARSHORT], [MONTH] and [DAY]
param.default: [YEAR] with 4 digit year, [YEARSHORT] with 2 digits year, [MONTH] and [DAY] of invoice creation (for proforma) or of payment (for final invoice) can also be used.

param.label: [GROWING_ID], [UNIQ_ID]
param.default: The [GROWING_ID] replacement can be used for a time-dependant, microsecond-resolution, 16-digits decimal uniqid(), which is always increasing, while [UNIQ_ID] can be used as a unique 16-digits id that looks random.

param.label: [ARTNUMS], [SITENAME], [SITEURL], [USERNAME], [NAME], [EMAIL], [cb_fieldname]
param.default: You can also use: [ARTNUMS] for article ids, [SITENAME], [SITEURL], [USERNAME], [NAME], [EMAIL] and any [cb_fieldname].

param.label: Example 1: Year + Number in year: 2013-0001
param.default:
If you want to start at invoice number 2012-0051, where 2012 is the current year, and 0051 the invoice number to be reset to 1 every new year:
Enter "[YEAR]-[NUMBER:0001:RESTART:YEARLY]" in the "Invoice number format" field, and "51" in the "Invoice reset starting number to" field once at begin.
First invoce number will then be "2012-0051" and then increment whole year. First invoice of 2013 will then be "2013-0001" and then increment from there.

param.label: Example 2: Date + Number in day: INV-2012-04-28-1
param.default:
If you want the date included in the invoice number and restart numbering each day, you can use for instance:
"INV-[YEAR]-[MONTH]-[DAY]-[NUMBER:0001:RESTART:DAYLY]" which will give e.g. "INV-2012-04-28-1" as first invoice on that day.
